title: Lorraine Kelly exposes 'unrecognisable' X Factor: Celebrity star Jeremy Edwards
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Lorraine Kelly managed to expose the true intentions of X Factor: Celebrity stars Jeremy Edwards and Brendan Cole.

The Holby City actor and former Strictly Come Dancing star are taking to the stage for the celebrity version of the ITV singing contest.

The celebs are looking to impress judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger and scoop a record deal.

But Lorraine joked that the friends, who could be the Robson and Jerome of a generation, just wanted to have a "jolly" in LA.

Asking why they decided to take part, Lorraine said: "It wasn’t that you wanted a jolly in Los Angeles by any chance?"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Giggling Jeremy replied: "I love that you see straight through us Lorraine. Everyone is giving it all 'I always wanted to be this singer'.

"We are like 'you want to pay us to go to Beverly Hills? First class Beverly Wilshire?' Boom."

While Brendan added: "We worked very hard."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: BBC)

Lorraine viewers took to Twitter after noticing how different Jeremy looked form his Hollyoaks days.

One viewer said: "OMG! Look at Jeremy Edwards!! Ha! I had to google him to see if he was the person I thought he was!!"

"He's totally different to his hollyoaks days!! I had the biggest crush on him back then....," added another.

A third said: "He's definitely looking like a dad these days :)"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Brendan explained that the pals , who have known each other for over a decade, did got to "muck around" but also took the competition seriously.

Jeremy added: "Brendan had the gig. They were interested in Brendan for obvious reasons. Some people like you.

"He gave me a call. He said 'look dude I don’t want to do it on my own, you want to come? I said 'yes'. We just had the best time. I think you’ll be pleasantly surprised."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The pair joked that pulling out some dance moves would be their secret weapon if the singing goes wrong.

Brendan also pointed out that he had switched allegiances from the BBC to ITV.

On Strictly, he said: "My friends are still there. I’ve watcheda couple of the episodes, not all of them.

"The great thing about this, I had 15 fanatic years on Strictly. I’m proud of the whole thing. That chapter has passed and now I’m on the other channel."

*Lorraine airs weekdays on ITV at 8.30am
description: The Holby City actor confessed Lorraine had seen 'straight through' him and former Strictly dancer Brendan Cole
